content.label:
Choose and equip your crew for each mission. Choose when and where they shoot and move. The bosses are a challenge, and it’s fun to repeat missions to not only build up points but also teach yourself the best way to deal with each kind of enemy.

Beware the black hole at the end, though. Maybe I misunderstood but it reset my game progress to noth8ng, leaving only with a postcard for all the hours, and hours and hours, I spent building my experience and inventory. I am too sad to replay the game now.

title.label: Very good indeed, but it’s too short for ten bucks

content.label: It’s just the game’s brevity that’s keeping me from giving it full marks. There’s some replayability (with difficulty levels and some board random generation); but if you’re exploring in a spaceship, who wants to go over old territory? The game would be a much better value for five bucks.
Game is a turn based game and very confusing. It was not what was expected from the video. Check a game play video before downloading.

The gameplay is fine. The payoff isn’t great in the end. Waiting for the enemy to take its turn when there are 50 little guys on there made me stop playing. It’s really annoying. Also most of the dialogue could be skipped. It’s not really relevant yet takes up a lot of time. Then there’s the docking process where you have to walk forever to meet with the next contact. Why make it so far away for no reason? I’m not even going to finish the game. The last level became ridiculously hard and I’m not sitting through each 20 minute turn from the enemy. Graphics are nice though.

Was playing and running great still is...I go to open the app today and now I’ve got no audio whatsoever. I’ve tried force closing the app restarting my iPad and nothing seems to work, dev please patch this as playing in silence really hinders the game ...

I bought the game immediately! It looked fun and from what I read, it seemed like it would be worth the $5. I can’t say it’s a great game because it eventually gets slow and repetitive. It’s fun enough to play when you’re bored. Strategy is really important and can definitely help you beat a level easily with low to no damage. Certain guns cannot be used by a specific player, which is ok after realizing that you don’t have to play as the captain, you can play as the other robots too! I do like that! One thing I don’t like is the fact that you have to buy storage boxes (with the water you earn, being that water is valuable because the characters are steambots) and you can’t keep things you want because with each level, the rewards or guns to buy are upgraded. Which is cool but if you have multiple steambots, you need more guns for them to use too.. there’s a lot I can say that needs to be fixed, but it’s not a necessity per say.. 

However! 

The one thing that almost made me delete the game, was that you CAN replay the game with all your steambots (or start fresh again from scratch).. BUT, you DON’T get all the stuff you earned and bought throughout the first playing of the game!!!!!!! 🤬🤬🤬🤬 No guns bought or earned, no water earned, no storage boxes bought or earned, NOT EVEN the player upgrades (leveled ups per player) that you earn throughout the game!!!!!! So you whether you choose to start brand new again at a higher level of difficulty or you choose to play the game with your steambots and a higher level or the same level of difficulty, YOU DO NOT get anything you worked hard to get.. you only get your crew, and nothing else. No upgrades, guns, nothing... 

Yeah I like the game, but come on!!!! That’s annoying lol It really was fun to play, but can I have all my stuff back?!? Guess not haha

I’ve had an itch for a good turn-based strategy game and SW Heist gives that to me in spades. It satisfies the nostalgia for my 90’s RPGs but is modern enough to keep me entertained. The pace is quick and the battles truly feel tactical (I’ve had devastating losses because of poor aim). Sometimes the robots arms waving slightly as you aim is a bit of an annoyance, but it keeps me paying attention to each shot. Overall the game is excellent, I’m just sad I may already be near the end of it. I hope they add an expansion or some kind of award tracking system to incentivize playing the game on the higher difficulties so I have a reason to keep coming back.
In a world full of games that are all the same... this one stands out. I love the art direction and the quirkiness of this game. Plus it’s just plain fun to play. Good job!

title.label: Please update to iPhone X screen

content.label: Good game but would be way better if devs would add more levels and make it compatible to the X’s scree.  Text is too small. Hopefully devs haven’t abandoned this game.
It’s a neat concept, but turn based gaming isn’t really for me. But the story is nice. Next time research before spending.
Fix for iPhone X
The gameplay is horrible, there aren’t many things to do. The controls are overwhelming. And it’s nothing like what it says it is. This game is trash, don’t make the same mistake I did!

title.label: Lovely but no support for iPhone X

content.label: This game is a blast but unfortunately it doesn't supports iPhone X and doesn't look nice. I had to delete it until the support comes out.

You rarely find a game this good for the iPad. It is really a gem! Well thought out, lots of fun, and does not indulge in money gouging, forcing you to buy gold, jewels, etc.  This game is well worth the money!!!

title.label: Sounds isn't working on iPhone x

content.label: No sound working at all on X

title.label: Great game / too much unnecessary talking

content.label:
My one quibble: virtually every conversation between characters has NOTHING to do with the game. You spend an inordinate amount of time clicking to get past word balloons to get to the actual gameplay. 

I hate to think of all of the time spent inventing conversations that are meaningless to the game. Perhaps next time they can put that effort into the actual game itself.
If you got an iPhone X skip this one, it’s like the devs have forgotten their own game.

Downloaded for a quick distraction, discovered a deep satisfying and fun strategy rpg. Over 12 hours in now and it’s continuing to surprise and challenge. Far past my expectations for an iOS game. 10/10.
This is an amazing game and I have played it for years. I hope they make another one that takes place afterward.
Great game, but can we get an update for iPhone X?
A lot of games that appear on multiple platforms suffer with touch controls but Steamworld Heist does not. Best of all, no in app purchases!!!  Pay once, and it’s worth it.

This game definitely is one of the best games in App Store. The experience is great, I judge that by if I would play a game through nonstop. I spent seven hours to finish the game, nonstop.
It reminds me Jagged Alliance a lot. They are all great turn based tactical games. But compare to JA, Steamworld Heist’s system is much less sophisticated. For one thing the dev chose side view, it makes the game completely 2 dimensional. And since units can not stay at ladders, the game space is shrunken too much. But JA uses 30 degree view, and units can go up to roofs, that makes JA 3 dimensional. So strategy part is much wider.
JA also uses a well designed motion point system. In this system, shooting costs motion points just like walking and other actions. Spending more points makes aiming more accurate. This is greatest system I’ve ever seen. But STeamworld Heist uses an oversimplified system, which makes the strategy much less variable.
I don’t know if there are certain reasons why iOS games could not reach the same height of PC games. I just don’t want to give any iOS game 5 stars. They are not worth it yet.

title.label: One of the best games EVER

content.label: It’s a rare fortune to come across a gem like this. The gameplay is just outstanding. This is one boldly innovative game that doesn’t seek to make unjust profits by flooding it with in-app purchases. You gain your in-game currency through your skill, experience and progress within the game, which is a huge breath of fresh air nowadays. A heartfelt thank you to the makers of this untainted beauty. For anyone reading this review, this one is a MUST PLAY. You won’t be disappointed, if you don’t mind exercising your brain a bit since it involves some juicy strategy.

title.label: One of the best games out there

content.label: I absolutely loved Paper Mario and playing this game was the closest I've ever come to playing it again. The story is cute but can be skipped if you're not into it, the physics with bullet ricochets and grenade bounces are challenging but engaging, and the little details all around this game gives a good sense of polished effort. There's so many different strategies you can employ with all the different characters, weapons, and utilities. And the hats are a fun sort of collection for the 100%ers out there.

title.label: High Quality Game that's Worth the Price

content.label: This is one of the best games that I've ever played on mobile/tablet. The art style and graphics are gorgeous and very colorful. The gameplay is top notch. You will instantly be hooked and be wanting to play for hours. If you're on the fence about picking this game up, just know that it will be worth the asking price and you'll be getting a high quality game.

title.label: I'm having a lot of fun with this game so far only....

content.label: I can't use heal items. I can select them but I have no way of using them. This is especially problematic in combat when I need to heal a character to y'know prevent their death but can't. Please fix this pronto.

Ok so I don't really ever write reviews but I had to for a game this awesome. This game is quite the challenge which is a good thing I'm always looking for games that pretty hard and this one is definitely at the top of my list. Very console like and worth the cost!!!!👍👍👍

title.label: Worth every penny and then some

content.label:
Such incredibly rich artwork, strategy, and tons of content.

Don't wait, download this now. But don't pay it on anything less than elite. Earn those levels.

When I downloaded this game I was very excited. I loved it and I loved it and I loved it. The way that you play this game is creative and brilliant. My only complaint is that I haven't found any rifles.
The gameplay is similar to XCOM to an extent. It is basically a battle chess game. You will need some strategy and calculate the bullet path

title.label: Great game, but it does not support iCloud saves

content.label: Unfortunately, the game does not have support for iCloud saves. So if I started playing on one device and wanted to continue playing on another, I can not do so. The only way to sync data is by going through the whole iCloud backup, delete, and restore all data process from a backup(which is very bad for someone with bad bandwidth). It is sad that this app does not support a way to upload save data to the cloud as other games have this feature.
Fantastic, turn-based combat game. The story looked enjoyable, but I honestly just played through, because I loved the mechanics so much.

title.label: Probably the best indie game I've played in a while

content.label: I highly recommend this game to anyone with a few extra bucks to spend, and have a lot of time to kill. I personally love this game SO MUCH, and I really want more levels! Totally worth the 10 dollars.
I will give it 5 stars when it gets the same DLC that is available for other platforms. I am tired to see good ios games sit without any updates while they are available on other platforms!
🎮Please🎮 port Steam World Dig for iOS. It is one of the 🥇 🎮greatest games of all time and having it with me make me feel comfortable.

This game has been seamlessly designed to stylishly inhabit an app niche and feed on-the-go cravings for quality game play that can be satisfying for a few minutes or a few hours.

I never wanted to be a space cowboy, but I love being a space cowbot. The tone of the game is somewhat whimsical like any good RPG, but has an understated comical flavor all of its own. 

I'm a sucker for good turn-based strategy, especially when it comes to apps, since you're rarely free from distractions when stealing away to play on your phone a moment. The difficulty level was so well balanced that I never had to grind, yet always felt challenged. When failure happened, I was torn about whether to replay the mission or run a couple easier ones and come back with better guns. On all occasions but one, I was able to refine my strategy and succeed, which was an incredibly rewarding experience.

Different members of your team get different weapons and skills. Realizing their strengths and weaknesses is key to identifying the niche they fill and creating a cohesive team.

If you're hesitating to risk the money, ask yourself if you want to waste your time playing another IAP shitshow, or do you want to enjoy your free time?

As a $4.99 game, it gave me 14 hours game play.
The music, details, and the game playing is awesome.

Hope there will be a DLC soon.
It's fun. There isn't much of a story, but I doubt you'll notice because you'll be having fun. Get it.
It's pretty good worth the ten bucks
Story to short only about 6 hours of gameplay I didn't even like the game the story was ok but it was a bad game altogether.
Great gameplay and story
Not worth the money honestly. Lack of weapon variety, crew cost to rebuild always half of your funds, bad AI in many cases. Maybe worth 1 or 2 bucks.
I just want to ask; why don't you give us an update so we can keep playing this amazing game? An extension would be very welcome. You can even charge for it.
The title says it all!

This game has serious issues.
The others who reviewed this game apparently did not play the same game I did.  The game is cute but it's implementation is terrible.

<<Issues>>
1.  No manual or docs of any sort.
2.  Extremely awkward character management.
3.  Extremely awkward inventory management.
4.  The levels are_not_ procedurally created.
5.  Upgrades that don't.
Turn-based bot-eliminating game set in bot-controlled space stations. It's not a bad game.

title.label: I wish I bought this a long time ago

content.label: The price always drove me away. There was no way I would pay $9.99 for an iPhone game. I even have a hard time considering $4.99 for a mobile game. Mainly because the games these days are such lower quality than the early 2000s. Now days it's common to pay $40 for a game that is only entertaining for a couple days. Where-as console games back in the day like Nintendo 64, GameCube, ps2 would last for months, sometimes years. Anyway, it wasn't until I lost the use of my left hand due to cancer that I needed to find one handed games. And when this went on sale I just got desperate for a game so I bought it & surprisingly, if I knew how much fun this game was I would have gladly paid full price a long time ago for it. I've been playing for days and it keeps getting better. Now I'm just hoping it lasts a long time because I dont want it to end. But yea, if you are debating to get it based on price, it's totally worth it. High quality, no bugs, really fun.
I throughly enjoy this game I just wish you had the outsider dlc as an in app purchase or something along those lines
This game was fun well designed and had a good story. Just think for the price it should've had more gameplay.
The game is ten dollars which means it's gonna be really good but the game doesn't have a long enough campaign so I hoping for more in the future
